185993654.review:
Kenshi es un RPG no lineal en el que escribes tu propia historia sin limitarte a seguir un camino prefijado.

Mi historia se titula: Juanita, el ciclo de Diógenes. 

Juanita, una humana que vivía como vagabunda en las calles de The Hub, hace tiempo atrás sus padres fueron arrebatados para ser esclavos. Esto marco mucho a Juanita. 

Ya con mayoría de edad ella decide migrar a una ciudad con más oportunidades, una vez en el lugar empieza a recolectar minerales para vender y vivir de esto. Un día en el bar de la ciudad conoce a Chona una Shek, es esclava de un noble local, Chona le pide favor de liberarla a un precio de 3000 cats, Juanita recordando el pasado traumatico que tuvo no puede evitar ayudarla. Una vez Chona liberada se hacen amigas inseparables y empieza a trabajar juntas en la mineria, pasa el tiempo y compran una casa. El esfuerzo da frutos.

Una noche caminando por las calles de la ciudad ven a una Shek llorando, extrañamente esta no tenia cuernos, Chona no puede controlar sus impulsos y pregunta ¿que ha pasado?, la chica se presenta como Ruka y les dice que su grupo la ha dejado porque en su ultima batalla perdió los cuernos y los Sheks siempre quieren transmitir poder y verse imponentes, por la falta de sus cuernos no podian permitirle estar con ellos. 

Ruka sabe que su historia no ha terminado, tiene las habilidades para hacer algo grande, pide favor si se puede unir a ellas, no tiene donde dormir. Juanita y Chona aceptan. Las tres chicas trabajan en mineria y hacen pijamadas, esto ayuda a reforzar su relación. Con el tiempo llegan a tener mucho dinero, aun así a Juanita no le gusta esa vida rutinaria de trabajo, ella recuerda que su padre, Mufasa, le contaba historias de piratas espaciales en busca del tesoro de mil mundos, Juanita quería vivir historias similares y buscar el tesoro que le cambiaría la vida. Le propone a Chona y Ruka un viaje sin dirección, sabiendo que las tres cuentan con experiencia en combate y podrán cuidarse entre ellas estas aceptan, así que proceden a vender todos sus bienes y parten a lo desconocido.

En su viaje liberan a unos pocos esclavos que se unen a ellas, pasan muchos sucesos en el camino, tienen batallas con bandidos, mercenarios y soldados. Poco a poco su grupo crece y se hace de un nombre, los Wachiturros. Pero más importante, se hacen una familia. Más adelante este grupo encuentra un lugar verde con agua, fauna y flora comestible, perfecto para establecerse y vivir en paz, la mayoría del grupo decide asentarse pero Juanita dice que aun no encuentra su tesoro y no parará hasta conseguirlo. Ruka trata de convencerla de quedarse pero esta hace caso omiso, Chona quiere quedarse pero no puede abandonar a su mejor amiga, así que las dos parten. Este episodio fue muy emotivo.

Llegan a ciudad donde los soldados son samurais muy bien entrenados, tienen que tener mucho cuidado al robar para poder alimentarse porque seria un reto enfrentarse a ellos. Juanita siendo una experta en saqueos por ser latina, toma el riesgo de allanar un establecimiento, la descubren y rápidamente los soldados las rodean. Logran abatir a varios pero Juanita es noqueada y llevada a prisión, Chona viendo que ella sola no puede hacerles frente decide escapar. Días después cuando la seguridad disminuye Chona se infiltra y logra sacar a Juanita, las dos huyen de la ciudad hasta quedarse sin aliento.

Cuando Chona enciende la fogata le pregunta a Juanita ¿que estas haciendo? estas persiguiendo algo que no sabes si siquiera existe, podemos morir si seguimos así. Juanita furiosa por lo que escucho le dice ¨yo no te pedí venir¨. Chona triste porque no pudo hacer entrar en razón a su amiga le dice que se irá, que espera que encuentre lo que busca y cuando eso pase regrese con el grupo. Chona se retira al amanecer.

Juanita pasa por muchas cosas, se enfrenta a caza-recompensas, a maquinas aracnoides, bestias de ciencia ficción, todo esto con el objetivo de encontrar su tesoro. Un día empieza a caer una lluvia roja extraña, levanta la mirada para contemplar ese cielo diferente, algo llama su atención, una construcción abandonada al pico de la montaña más alta. Lo encontré ella piensa, y se dirige al lugar. Entra al lugar y hay tecnología que ella nunca había visto, almacenes cerrados con quien sabe que y varios materiales valiosos esparcidos por los suelos. En eso caen arañas delgadas a su alrededor, ya se había enfrentado a ellas con anterioridad pero estas eran demasiadas para hacerles frente. Intenta huir pero cae, ve rojo a su alrededor, preguntándose si es la lluvia extraña que cae del cielo o su sangre, repentinamente todo se vuelve negro.

Despierta, milagrosamente logro sobrevivir porque los seres que la atacaron perdieron interés al momento que dejo de retorcerse. Al incorporarse logra caminar pero con un dolor punzante e insoportable en el abdomen, solo piensa que tiene que llegar a un lugar seguro. Después horas de camino logra dislumbrar a la lejanía, un pueblo aproximadamente a un día de distancia al ritmo que ella llevaba, esa noche decide descansar en una colina, encender una fogata y tratar sus heridas, al rato de esto se recuesta y ve al cielo diciéndose a ella misma que no sabe que hacer, ¨estoy perdida¨ ella exclamó, sus ojos se humedecen y piensa que es la misma niña que perdió a sus padres tiempo atrás, nada ha cambiado, sigo sola durmiendo en el exterior. Ve al cielo oscuro de nuevo, esta vez sus ojos se posan en el planeta que nunca desaparece del horizonte siempre acompañada de su luna, es poético que siempre una se tenga a la otra en compañía, ella pensó. En ese momento que se dio cuenta que mucho estoicismo hace mal y que el verdadero tesoro son los amigos que hizo en el camino.

185955424.review:
9/10 A fantastic In-depth sandbox rpg with a variety of factions, areas, and races. It could just do with a more intuitive hud and story based missions (look to mods for those) . 

Narrative: It's a sandbox game so the story is up to you to make as you interact with rival/neutral factions who will try to kill or befriend you based upon your ties or race. You can be a bounty hunter, bandit, religious zealot, a ninja, a slave(r), a cannibal, a robot, etc etc just pick wisely because people will base their opinions off of your appearance and status. As for the setting, the best I can do to describe it is say the events take place in a desert dystopia with you trying to survive with no end in site (until you get bored and abandon the game).

Gameplay: The game comes with base building (and all that entails), real time melee/ranged combat, and faction management. The base building can be done anywhere except in cities/towns where you will have to buy a building to do it and you need to be in good/neutral standing with the cities main faction. Also, if you build in someone's territory they will tax you so be mindful if you aren't allied with them because combat will ensue. The combat is always real time and can be automated or manually controlled. To get the best results you will have to train the people you recruit or spawn as in your group . Even then there are no guarantees of survival so be sure to craft or purchase the best equipment you can to keep your faction alive. Faction/base wise, you can make your own at anytime or join another one. If you make your own then you will be seen as hostile to anyone you don't  have a good standing and build on their territory. Be warned base building is something you should do after recruit a high number of people or else you will be overwhelmed by the strength and numbers of other factions.

Summary: It's a complex yet low graphic game with a  massive amount of options for building or surviving in an enormous sandbox map. If you are up for the experience and don't mind the jank then this is a good try.

185944846.review:
I have left it for far too long to write an actual review for this game. In short, Kenshi is an absolute masterpiece. No two ways about it. I could write an entire essay on its merits and the underlying philosophy of the game, but Steam reviews are hardly the best place for that.

In terms of gameplay, it is a sandbox RPG of the purest variety. No quest list, no quest markers, no handholding of any kind. You are thrown into the world and you have to forge your own path through it from a list of open-ended starting scenarios. These include starting as a slave to religious zealots, starting as two companions (read: morons) who are pursued by cannibals after a disastrous foray into their territory, and, iconically, a start in which you are naked, alone, and quite literally unarmed in the middle of a desert.

Immediately, once you leave a city, you will be accosted by vagabonds, who are likely all stronger, faster, and more skilled than you. Provided you don’t bleed out in the wastes, you will repeat this process. Again. And again. And again. Until you realise that you’re managing to take out one of them at a time. Then two. Then three. 

This is the core loop of Kenshi, and the primary element of the game’s philosophy: fall down, then get up, repeat ad infinitum. The game’s description in the store puts it best: you are not the chosen one. You are just like everyone else in this world. You are not special. Like everyone else, you will fall down. You construct your legend by pulling yourself back up, every single time. I believe some element of the player has to hate themselves in order to truly love this game in full; the rather sadistic philosophy of Kenshi and the fantasy of brutal self-improvement it provides lends itself to those so inclined.

The setting of the game, and the exploration thereof, is nothing short of absolutely phenomenal. Storytelling is primarily told through the environment, with light context given by certain NPCs. The basic gist is that the game is set on a world in seemingly permanent decline, with the technology of yesteryear seen rusting and decaying. The contrast this provides is profound; high-tech robots, known in game as Skeletons, are present, and even they fight with low-tech swords and crossbows.

However, all of this praise is not to say that the game does not have its flaws. The outdated UI and subpar graphics, combined with the brutally high difficulty, may be a turnoff for some players. Additionally, it is hard to resist the temptation of mods to fix leftover bugs and add some QoL features to make the gameplay a tad smoother.

In spite of these few flaws, however, Kenshi remains a masterpiece. If you thoroughly enjoy sandbox RPGs, and can bear the inherent jank of the game, I firmly believe you will find one of the greatest works of art ever made. It’s an easy 10/10, but certainly not everyone’s cup of tea.

There was one aspect, or rather a combination of aspects that made me spend 200+ hours. I was base building and raising your squad. These elements apart - the game is so unfinished and empty, is it baffling to me. 

There is no story and almost no lore, you can speak with selected 3 characters, of billions of NPCs. Bugs make you resolve to save scumming, even though the game and community would say that you be not afraid of loosing (no I will not let half of my base die because they forgot to eat, thank you very much). Performance is exceptionally bad, you'd be forcibly paused while you running, because game need to load a bunch of the same desert textures.

It is not one of those big games, like terraria, mount&blade or (god forbid) no man's sky, where you'd think people playing hundreds of hours are having new content. No, in my experience - what you see in the first hour is what you get. There is no hidden treasure, everything is extremely underwhelming. 

Do I regret playing? No. But I wish I've abandoned the game earlier.

185855752.review:
Kenshi is fantastic. This is in spite of its jank, the age and volatility of its engine, its plethora of bugs, its cumbersome UI, and its grindy gameplay. The game has no real focus; depending on the person playing, there are probably a plethora of systems that the game has that you do not engage with; there are simply that many systems in the game competing with a game like Fallout 4 in that regard, with both base-building and solo play being valid ways to experience Kenshi. While other games would and do suffer from what would be considered bloat in this case, Kenshi instead thrives. This is because Kenshi has a clarity of vision; it knows what it wants to be and moves uncompromisingly towards its ideal self. The game has a ton of questions that can be answered by keeping this in mind. Why are there so many katanas in this deeply strange post-apocalyptic setting? Because it's fucking sick as hell! Kenshi is kind of merciless in the way that it requires a lot of knowledge to even be playable, but this is because structuring the game in a way that would be more player-friendly might delude you into thinking that the game cares, which it does, but it doesn't want to show that. 

The game is also deeply goofy. I complain about the grind, but it is very funny how one of the better ways to train strength in Kenshi is to fill a backpack with garbage, carry a dead body, and just walk around. Another example is the fact that it is filled with these strange characters that are charming in their strange ways. (armor king, burn, beep) One of the best ways to make money is to chop your legs off, put prosthetics on, and then ferry insane amounts of Hashish to a gentrified techie neighborhood. (Flats Lagoon) It also has these fun names for its creatures. One of the notorious terrors of the early game is, of course, the Beak Thing, named such because it has a beak and is a thing. The game is, in fact, so goofy that it might be able to distract you from the fact that the texture of a Beak Thing is, in fact, stretched out human, which is a wonderful touch.

Unfortunately, Kenshi the game is grind-based. If you aren't in the very early game or have hit a point where you can comfortably explore the map, then what you will be doing is grinding. Grinding for materials, grinding for cats (cash), or grinding stats, Kenshi doesn't have a focus, but it does have a gameplay loop, and that loop is grinding. If you are not in it for the grind, then you aren't for Kenshi. This is also where the satisfaction of Kenshi comes in, the point of the game is slowly getting stronger and overcoming self-imposed challenges when you feel ready. And when it is that game, it is deeply engaging. Unfortunately, Kenshi loses a lot of its charm when you become proficient at it. When you learn all the little secrets to make your life easier, suddenly, what you struggled for tens of hours to achieve can be done in a mere hour or two. (You can juice up your combat stats super quickly by simply fighting groups of crabs like you can get from the tens and twenties to the mid-fifties in about half an hour.) This turns one of the other good aspects of Kenshi, aimless wandering (good) into aimless wandering (bad). Which isn't ideal. 

Still, Kenshi is well worth it if you are patient and enjoy progression in gaming. If nothing else, Kenshi is an example of a game that is more because it is so uncompromising in design, and that alone is enough for me to recommend it; the fact that the game is excellent on top of that is just a bonus.

185851461.review:
🌟 Review of Kenshi 🌟

Rating: ★★★★☆ (4/5)

Kenshi is a breath of fresh, arid wasteland air in the world of sandbox RPGs. It offers a sprawling, unforgiving open-world experience that is as brutal as it is rewarding. The game's complexity and depth are truly astounding, with a world that feels alive and indifferent to your survival—exactly what makes it so addictive.

Pros:

Immersive World: The landscape is vast and meticulously crafted. Every journey feels like an expedition into the unknown.

Freedom: You can be anything you want—a trader, a thief, a warlord, or a simple wanderer. The game doesn't hold your hand, and the narrative is entirely driven by your actions.

Character Development: The progression system is well thought-out. Training up a squad and watching them grow from helpless nobodies into formidable warriors is immensely satisfying.

Atmosphere: The game's ambiance, from the eerie desert nights to the bustling cities, is top-notch. The music complements the setting perfectly, enhancing the immersion.

Cons:

Steep Learning Curve: Kenshi is not for the faint-hearted. The game throws you into the deep end, and the learning curve is steep. But once you get the hang of it, the experience is incredibly rewarding.

Graphics and Performance: While the art style is unique and fitting, the graphics can sometimes feel dated. Additionally, performance issues can arise, particularly on lower-end systems.

Bugs and Glitches: There are occasional bugs and glitches that can disrupt gameplay. However, the frequent updates and active community help mitigate these issues.

Final Thoughts: Kenshi is a unique gem that stands out in the gaming landscape. Its brutal difficulty, deep mechanics, and vast open world make it a must-play for fans of sandbox RPGs. Despite some rough edges, the game's ambition and scope are commendable. If you're looking for a game that challenges you and offers a true sense of freedom and discovery, Kenshi is worth every second of your time.

185837818.review:
Графика:
Уровень графики оставляет желать лучшего. NPC и ландшафт буквально сливаются друг с другом, что затрудняет восприятие игрового мира.

Управление:
Камера неудобная и требует постоянной подстройки, что усложняет процесс игры.

Ролевая составляющая:
Игра предлагает минимальную симуляцию жизни. Нет необходимости спать, отдыхать, пить воду, или бороться с болезнями. Для RPG это явный минус, ведь атмосфера погружения от этого сильно страдает.

Контент:
По сути, в игре мало чем можно заняться. Основная цель сводится к тому, чтобы прокачаться и отправиться убивать всех вокруг. Взаимодействий с NPC практически нет, а вариативность действий крайне ограничена.

Мир:
Мир кажется мертвым и лишённым жизни. Взаимодействие с окружением минимальное, а возможности для разнообразного геймплея практически отсутствуют.

Прокачка навыков:
Система прокачки вызывает недоумение. Игрок буквально вынужден грузить рюкзак камнями, закидывать на плечо труп бандита и бегать так несколько часов, чтобы повысить силу или другие навыки. Это выглядит нелепо, учитывая, что в реальной жизни люди давно придумали тренажёры и гантели. Геймплей сводится к абузу игровых механик, и, судя по прохождениям других игроков, без этого просто не обойтись.

Взлом:
Механика взлома — это отдельный комичный элемент. Взломать можно практически всё буквально одним ногтем. Надели на вас кандалы? Не проблема! Заперли в клетке? Пара попыток мизинцем — и вы на свободе. А попытки к тому же не ограничены.

Итог:
Kenshi — это тотальная скука и уныние, где гринд ради гринда становится основной механикой. В игре не хватает глубины, вариативности и логики в проработке ключевых элементов геймплея.

185821039.review:
This frankly is one of the best games I've ever played. I've barely scratched the surface but already I'm lost in this vast, fascinating yet unforgiving world. Kenshi is a game where you are going to fail. It rewards learning from failure and keeps beckoning you to go further and further.  Unless you have the patience of a 5 year old iPad kid who hasn't taken his ritilin, it's absolutely worth playing. 

The world is just stunning to look at, and really pulls off "show don't tell". There isn't much in the way of written quests or lore. However you can't help but look at a world where swords and crossbows are the most advanced weapon systems, yet there's wreckage of gigantic space craft and what seem like ancient combat mechs strewn over the place and ask yourself "WTF happened here?!". 

It's sadistically difficult at the start. Move ten feet in any direction  and you're having your arms and legs broken. It's frustrating at first because modern games have conditioned me and others to expect a certain level of hand-holding.  Though the mechanics are quite deep and varied, they aren't that complicated. After an hour or two of having the living shit beaten out of you over and over because you dared to have a crust of bread someone else wants, the mechanics and UI begin to click. You notice in the stats page your charector is getting tougher, faster as he's chased and beaten for his bread. 

Someone in a bar joins you, suddenly you can actually put up a good fight before your bread crusts get taken. More people join and you realise you can order squad mates around and actually fight back against the bandits. Things click more. Now you have some basic weapons, armour and feel as if you're invincible and sally out into the vast world, confident having overcome the learning curve of this game. Then in the next valley get eaten alive by creatures named beak something.

185818069.review:
Kenshi is potentially one of the best games I have ever tried to play...It mixes so many aspects of my favorite genres like city building, RPG, open world, sandbox economy and much more. While at the same time being incredibly unforgiving. 

This might be a stretch but it constantly reminds me of the MMO Star Wars Galaxies but obviously single player. You truly can do whatever you want and you literally live with those choices. 

Do you want to start a small outpost that sells drugs? Go for it. If you set up shop in the wrong region a Holy Nation representative will certainly find out. 

Do you want to be a strong solo adventurer who uncovers the secrets of the wasteland. Be my guest. You might get eaten a long the way.

There are so many reviews that do a better job than this but I think it truly is a masterful attempt at an Open World RPG. You will not understand in the first few hours. You will get frustrated and it will feel very steep. But I promise once you find a niche or groove that you like you wont be able to put it down.

185814142.review:
I love this game.

I hate the one weirdo I recruited who kept eating from my animal trough at base.  He died.  I do not miss him.

It really is just one of those games you can pick up and play however you want.  I can't think of a single thing this game really overtly forces on you.  Just start a playthrough and make it up as you go.  As far as I've experienced, it's really the only game that's done this exceptionally well.  Many games promise this big open world where "the story is yours and blah blah blah" and Kenshi actually delivered that.

It's difficult.  Whatever you want to do, you'll have to earn it through a pile of failures.  I don't usually gravitate towards games that are well known for just being punishingly difficult, but Kenshi does it well and never really feels like it's artificial and just thrown in there for the sake of making it harder.  It's just part of the world and the only way to really build your characters up.  It's actually part of the gameplay loop rather than being a barrier.  Once you actually accomplish whatever you set out to do, it actually leaves a mark on the world and makes it feel like you've actually done something within a living world which is insanely compelling regardless of the graphics.

It's good.  Certified video game.

185750380.review:
A slow burn but worth the struggle. Do yourself a favor, pretend it’s a time when we didn’t have access to reliable guides for everything. Morrowind is the most direct comparison for me, even though Kenshi has extremely limited dialogue, and no grand plan for you.

Where it’s like Morrowind is the exploration and discovery. Closer to “radiant storytelling,” but even that’s generous. You tell the story here. Zero hand holding. Forget quest markers, there are no quests. The world keeps going while you’re doing your thing, and you’ll decide if, when, and where to jump in to things. Except everything wants to kill or enslave you.

Give it a shot. If you don’t like it, give it another shot. It takes failure to not only learn game mechanics, but to train character skills. If you're really struggling and about to give up, I suggest searching for some way to get early game money. But do not read up on the game beyond that. Go in blind and fail until you don’t. Enjoy.

185720780.review:
Это игра о свободе человека, она не ставит перед игроком конкретных целей и задач. Никто не обязывает тебя следовать определённому пути. Ты сам выбираешь, чем заниматься, и следуешь своим амбициям.

Эта игра предоставляет каждому игроку возможность найти свою отдушину.

Возможно, вы посчитаете меня безумцем, но я провёл 250 часов в режиме AFK, исследуя Равнины Людоедов. Я выживал и сражался с бесчисленной ордой людоедов. И мне это нравилось.

В игре есть множество других возможностей. Открытый мир со своей историей, которую нужно собирать по крупицам. Исследуй этот мир, ходи по древним руинам, сражайся с врагами, разговаривай с NPC, набирай отряд, строй от простой кибитки до огромной крепости, настраивай цели и автономность своим отрядам и постепенно погружайся в историю погибшего мира.

А хочешь, ходи и сражайся с людоедами, как я 250 часов!

之前看主播玩看视频就没看下去过，寻思自己买来品一品。只能说不管内容物是有虾仁还是有玉米，这游戏都是一坨游戏工业残次品。

没看攻略，只根据教程开始游戏。

开局把我放到了枢纽城，熟悉了一下操作。
先看了一圈城里，城里只有商人、首领、可招募人物和普通人物四种。商人只能交易，首领只能赎人赎货，招募人物就是招募，普通人物都不能对话。
第一个问题来了，怎么赚钱买食物活下来。
1。先把地上瓶瓶罐罐捡了买，挣了一百多买肉干。
2。商人的物品有定价均价，判断为可以跑商，然而不知道各地价格，没有启动资金，很难挣。
3。出门转转遇到土匪，带回城里让警卫打完再剥，然而哪能总有敌对人路过，一等就等半天。
4。出门转转发现唯一的可互动物——矿石，猛敲完发现实在太tm无聊了。
5。中继站出门狼窝，有猛人单挑我捡尸。
6。出门转转发现村废墟、旧前线，满地的垃圾武器和素材。扫一眼全卖了能挣一万。
然后跑了几趟卖烦了，再也不玩。

纯纯打工模拟，巨无聊巨花时间，之后该怎么玩想想就知道了。商店里的装备蓝图，建造系统就是张大饼。等我打工赚够了，买了装备，开始打假人练技能继续打工呗，等人物等级够杀野怪野人接着打工，赚够买队友的钱再接着打工给队友凑装备。再接着打工攒基地做科技。然后呢？暴打土著？扫图？真的有意思吗

又看了点视频，什么盗圣、双腿残疾满世界爬，也就视频里好像有点意思，自己上手3倍速健全🦵都懒的跑，地图做的也不好看，一点探索欲望都没有。剧情就是随便安排个NPC聊两句，给个设定当世界观。

He rehecho la reseña por que lo primero el juego me gusta y le estoy intentando pillar la gracia( de momento solo he sufrido la verdad) no entendi nada del juego cuando lo probe hace unos dias, aparte despues de verme algunos tutoriales ya entiendo los conceptos mas avanzados tras crear una civilizacion, voy a hacer la critica de nuevo y con mas puntos que aclaren el por que pense y sigo pensando que es un buen juego pero tiene muchos mas contras que pros y eso no es normal, no deberia ser asi al menos ya no deberia en estos años por que esto no es nada nuevo, simplemente es algo que cuesta por que es un juego extenso pero no han creado la formula de la cocacola, me explico supongo.

(ademas a dia de hoy cada juego que sacan sale roto y sin terminar, este no a sido una excepcion en cosas basiquisimas como las dimensiones de objeto, aparte no entiendo por que no hay una sola construccion que no se me haya bugeado y me haya hecho destruirla y tener que volver a hacerla y eso hace que pierdas un 25% de los materiales, aparte que gracia las casas, estan todas totalmente mal hechas, estructuras de tipo almacen son un ptisimo desastre, los muros cada vez que he tenido que ponerlos me han entrado ganas de sacarme los ojos, las torretas para los muros y las casas al estar la estructura mas bug que cyberpunk pues es una locura, un 50/50 de que sea funcional y no se bugee, en fin ya se puede intuir como esta diseñada la construccion... Tan dificil no creo que fuera poner una plantilla de recuadros en el suelo tipo minecraft y haber dejado de tanta pelicula con flechitas, puntos y paranoias)

Voy a enumerar los puntos que veo bien y mal por que se me hace de noche...
                                                

                                                                       PROS
1-(Este depende de ti en varios aspectos)Es un juego no infinito pero practicamente, para acabar una run habria que hacer tantas cosas que es preferible comprar un terreno en la vida real y hacerlo de verdad. (Contenido repetitivo en algunos casos pero dependiendo de tu manera de jugar cambia totalmente)

2-El mapa es impresionante,la ambientacion, los sonidos, la musica esta muy bien elegida (aveces) el mapa es lo mejor del juego, ademas de que tiene varios mods que lo cambian por completo, eso no deberia de ser un punto positivo por que es contenido de la comunidad pero bueno si no fuera la h0stia de serie no lo seria con mods.

3-La manera de empezar y de desarrollarse posteriormente es casi perfecta, puedes desbalancearla si quieres comprandote todo en tiendas (farmeando cobre antes claro xDD) pero para eso ya tendras que explorarte el mapa casi entero y no es poco tiempo, poco a poco vas haciendo las construcciones iniciales y vas viendo como al automatizar los trabajos el pueblo cobra vida, al tiempo te das cuenta de que ya no son 15/20 pringaos dando vueltas a literalmente cuatro casas, ahora las 15/20 son casas y el pueblo esta lleno de gente y estan haciendo sus vidas y dedicandose a sus trabajos (bueno aveces se bugean y se quedan to rallaos mirando paredes pero no es lo comun xD) Basicamente eso esta casi perfecto.

4-Tus ciudades son la h0stia si pero las de los NPCs aun mas, me refiero a que cada ciudad a la que iba al empezar el juego me ha dejado mirando por fuera las construcciones, a la ropa de los guardias, las personas dentro de las tiendas(aparte que hay dialogos exclusivos de NPCs unicos que se pueden añadir como pj)
Mas que nada es por la buena ambientacion que han logrado, si le pusiesen otro tipo de paleta de colores en mi opinion quedaria mejor, la que hay actualmente es demasiado fria, deberia tener mas balance en muchas regiones y climas.

5-La libertad que te da el juego es algo muy loco, puedes hacer lo que quieras, a ver claro que no puedes por defecto hacerlo todo pero poniendo mods si, ademas hay varios canales en yt que explican perfectamente como crear casi todo tipo de mods para que añadas lo que te guste.



6-(No deberia pero lo voy a poner) La comunidad de mods es bastante buena,hay bastante variedad, ami me han hecho gracia los mods de star wars, bastante dedicacion los chavales, no es para tirar cohetes por que como siempre pasa no se tienen en cuenta unos a otros al crear las cosas asi que al poner varios mods normalmente petara al abrir el juego, no es necesario ni que sean mods similares y cambien el mismo contenido, yo ya creo que peta por que le apetece xD Ademas de que ya tiene unos requisitos descomunales para los pocos graficos que en realidad tiene(a no ser que acerques la camara no hay nada sin pixelar) al poner los mods se vuelve mucho peor en rendimiento, al construir me ha crasheado diciendo que me falta ram y que me baje los graficos (estabane en alto nisiquera en ultra) ademas de que tengo 32gb asi que no se que mas esperan...
                                 
                                         Abajo en los comentarios pongo los contras

Проиграв в этот шедевр 300 часов, я понял несколько вещей:
1) решил построить базу?: Будь готов опиздюливаться от всех и от налоговой в том числе
2) Из-за большого количества модов игра часто вылетает, поэтому ставьте нужные, полезные и просто моды для души
3) Выжить в одиночку почти не возможно, нужен второй персонаж 100%
Ибо когда ты пойдешь в Мщение чтобы полутаться будь готов опиздюлиться от невольников
и к тому что тебя добьет Глаз бога который выжигает все и вся
4) Не недооценивай своих врагов. можешь напасть на одного среднего врага но будь готов что из-за поворота
или из-за холма выбежит целая мать его армия
5)Сначала ты будешь страдать ибо эта игра пожирает время незаметно, но потом ты привыкаешь к этому и полностью принимаешь весь кайф от игры.
Подведем итоги:

185547704.review:
Mi tiempo con Kenshi ha sido un viaje sorprendente, uno que comenzó con cierto escepticismo y terminó con una profunda admiración que se ha traducido en esta cantidad de horas.

Al principio, los gráficos rudimentarios (realmente horribles) y el aspecto tosco del juego casi me ahuyentan. Pero había algo en las historias que veía en línea, relatos tan únicos como sus jugadores, que me hizo reconsiderar. Decidí darle una oportunidad, y lo que encontré fue una experiencia tan cruda y compleja que cambió mi percepción de lo que un videojuego puede ser.

En Kenshi, los gráficos son, en esencia, una puerta destartalada que puedes elegir embellecer con mods si lo deseas, hasta llegar a algo realmente bonito y espectacular si sabes cómo configurarlo. Pero pronto te das cuenta de que el verdadero encanto del juego no reside en su apariencia, sino en su idea: en la manera en que te enfrenta a su mundo y te obliga a adaptarte. Aquí no hay héroes predestinados ni grandes profecías. Comienzas siendo un don nadie: alguien sin nombre, sin propósito, sin habilidades. Eres una mota de polvo en medio de una violenta tormenta de arena, y el juego no hace nada por disfrazar esta realidad.

La hostilidad del mundo de Kenshi no tiene paralelos. Apenas des un paso fuera de tu zona inicial, descubrirás que casi todos los habitantes de este mundo quieren algo de ti, y rara vez es algo bueno.

Encontrarás bandidos que te perseguirán para esclavizarte, saquearte o solo para golpearte por simple diversión; bestias salvajes o seres caníbales que te atacarán y te atraparán para devorarte, y facciones enteras que podrían aniquilarte simplemente porque existes. Aquí, la tiranía, el racismo y la xenofobia no son conceptos distantes; son reglas fundamentales que rigen el día a día. Y, sin embargo, esta brutalidad no es solo un castigo. Es un lienzo sobre el que pintas tu historia, donde cada victoria, por pequeña que sea, se siente como un triunfo real.

La magia de Kenshi está en su simulación, que crea una narrativa dinámica donde el azar de los encuentros y las decisiones de los jugadores se entrelazan. Cada derrota puede ser el comienzo de algo nuevo: ser esclavizado no necesariamente significa el final, sino otra etapa en tu camino. Podrás reclutar a otros que, como tú, buscan algo en este mundo destruido: redención, venganza, conocimiento, aventuras o simplemente el gusto por viajar. Cada uno trae consigo su propia historia y propósito, y con ellos (y sus diálogos particulares) puedes construir algo más, desde una banda itinerante de supervivientes o aventureros, hasta un asentamiento que desafíe las reglas de la sociedad o que simplemente busques vivir en paz con una granja de cactus en algún lugar apartado del resto del mundo.

Ahora, desde el punto de vista técnico, Kenshi no es perfecto. Parece que cojea con una pata sin tener ninguna.

Hay bugs ocasionales, crasheos esporádicos (cómo odio esto) y una curva de aprendizaje que puede alejar a los menos perseverantes. La interfaz puede ser un poco tosca al principio, y el motor gráfico muestra su edad (en serio, es horrible xD). Pero, curiosamente, estas imperfecciones terminan alimentando la esencia del juego: un mundo áspero, imperfecto, que no se acomoda a ti, sino que te exige moldearte a él y, de alguna forma, te acostumbras y terminas agarrándole cariño.

En cuanto a la historia, es el jugador quien la crea. No hay una narrativa tradicional guiada por cinemáticas o misiones predefinidas, aunque existe un trasfondo que puedes ir descubriendo, pieza por pieza, si te aventuras en sus ruinas y escuchas (lees) los diálogos de la gente, en donde descubres el por qué el mundo terminó así y aun así todavía quedan misterios por resolver. Pero, en general, todo se genera a partir de tus elecciones, de tu voluntad por explorar.

Kenshi no es un juego para todos. Es una experiencia que requiere paciencia, estrategia y, sobre todo, imaginación. Pero para quienes estén dispuestos a adentrarse en este mundo y enfrentarse a su brutal hostilidad, este juego ofrece algo raro en los videojuegos: una experiencia verdaderamente personal y memorable, donde cada cicatriz en tu personaje, cada rincón descubierto y cada largo viaje a pie a través de sus desérticos, inhóspitos y únicos paisajes, cuentan una historia que es solo tuya. Y esa, creo, es su mayor virtud.

185476780.review:
This game has potential but hits you with a game breaking bug after several hours of play. Pathing breaks and you can no longer get around.

There are other warning signs of instability the longer the game goes on. In its current state I cannot recommend it. The stability of the internal model is poor and the game expects you to have to take the place of the developer to constantly fix the integrity of the data model.

I'm not sure that it's possible to play without your save getting corrupted behind the scenes in one way or another. The approach to bug fixing taken in this game is not to actually fix bugs in many cases but to suppress their visibility. I would not be surprised if almost everything in the code is wrapped with try catch continue. Currently for example a shop keeper appears to be missing in my game and I assume he has somehow gotten himself killed as in hive villages the shop keeper will sometimes chase you all around.

This game has a fair amount of automation for your units but makes a mistake similar to X4. Things get attacked or worse than that simply stop moving inexplicably and without sufficient notice or information. If someone gets killed you have to jump through hoops to keep notice of it. It's a kind of mechanic that screws you over behind your back. You would have to be masochistic to enjoy that.

Once or twice might be frustrating but challenging. It breaks down when the ways around it aren't always that satisfactory and especially when the challenge is so contrived resulting often from such a tiny and straight forward missing feature or simply exacerbated on top of another problem such as the pathing breaking.

There are a number of other small things that ruin the ability to properly enjoy the game. You have to press alt to steal things but then if you try to go into a shop and then someone closes it your character attacks the door to break in and then that's it, the whole town attacks and you have to reload.

There is a building you can buy in the hub and there's a palm tree growing in it. Little things like this should be so easy to fix and I don't understand why it's there.

Many parts of this game rely upon obscuring your vision and forcing micromanagement in a way that simply is not fun. It turns into pure tedium. The game insists on forcing this mechanic that's attempting to induce eye strain. You can't see names or markers for corpses, NPCs or monsters.

The game also has a little bit of an issue with multiple monitors. If you mouse out to change something in another window expect the camera to go nuts. It also lacks small niceties such as a compass so that you can simply see which direction you're facing.

The game has crashed in at least two instances and in others gotten into a state where the camera is broken and stuck tracking something in an inconsistent state or it stops accepting mouse input forcing Alt + F4 shutdown where you then have to restart. In another instance someone managed to teleport somewhere and get stuck.

In a few cases the GUI is really inefficient and fiddly. There is a general though sporadic lack of optimisation which includes cases of CPU and GPU usage.

The developers of this game do not seem to understand what is and isn't a meaningful gaming dynamic. They seem to think that wasting time counts as play time and therefore added value. There is a confused mixture of time saving features that don't work because of a refusal to implement the simplest of crucial features required to properly use speed up features such as pause when targeted.

The primary solution to this is to not use it making it pointless much of the time. You then either have to spend half or more of the game play time effectively sitting at a loading screen or you speed it up but just reload whenever something goes wrong constantly losing several minutes to the hour resetting your progress. Part of the problem is that timings are not quite balanced and due to certain features in the game it's hard to do this including levelling up speed. The game also really wants a half speed mode due to this. At normal speed something that is high level will be three times faster and run around as though playing at three times speed when in normal mode.

There are various RSI inducing elements such as having to click through every single character which could be a few dozen to see who needs healing. There is another mistaken game design concept where the developers appear to be under the false impression that not showing you stuff with no option for the player to choose the level of visibility they would like despite this being extremely easy to implement constitutes a meaningful gaming challenge as opposed to unnecessary difficulty. If there were the simply implementation of a feature to show if someone needs healing or not this would be set back by a bug preventing full healing until damaged again.

It's a real shame, this is one of those games I would want to promote and recommend but can't due to a lack of finish and continued support. It fails on QA and has stopped shortly before the finishing line. I find this stupid. It seems like such a waste to put in all that work and to then give up in the last moment when you've almost made it.

No os dejéis engañar por lo gráfico, el juego es de lo más completo que encontraréis nunca.

En este título escribes tu propia historia, el mundo del juego se desarrolla en una luna brutal, en la que en las primeras horas de juego hasta un bandido muerto de hambre te puede dejar medio muerto. En el juego tú decides qué hacer y qué ser. Puedes ser un comerciante y recorrer el mundo del juego vendiendo tus artículos hasta montar una tienda. Puedes ser un cazarrecompensas y ir tras los bandidos más buscados o entregar miembros de facciones importantes a otras. Puedes ser un narcotraficante y vender droga en las diferentes ciudades intentando pasar desapercibido. Puedes ser un esclavista o un esclavo. Un miembro de una facción en particular. Lo que quieras.

El juego se desarrolla estés tú o no, no eres un gran héroe ni un elegido de nada, eres un don nadie en el juego y solo conseguirás ser mejor a base de práctica y caídas constantes.

Es difícil hacer una reseña a este título, ya que tiene infinidad de cosas que ofrecer pero a la vez creo que es un juego que no es para todo el mundo por la dificultad que tiene.
Aún así ánimo a jugarlo ya que para mí se a convertido de mis juegos favoritos.

Recomiendo instalar mods de la workshop, es un juego con una comunidad muy activa que tiene mods que hacen la experiencia del juego mucho más pulida y puedes añadir muchas cosas al mismo.

Gracias a jujalag por descubrirme este título. Juegazo.

185400591.review:
I got this game a little over two weeks ago, and it has consumed my life.

Kenshi is a messy masterpiece. The learning curve is somehow extremely punishing but also very forgiving. The game will not hold back and will hurt you, but you will become stronger for it. You will lose squad members, limbs, and loot. Sometimes, you have to make the difficult decision between carrying the bag of books and salvage from that ancient ruin or saving the mercenary that got downed by blood spiders to get you that bag. 
His screams as he was eaten alive will haunt me.

The engine is iffy at times, and sometimes it breaks under the strain of how BIG Kenshi is, but the game includes the tools you need to set things right. This framework can be extended on by a large workshop collection to branch out into almost anything you want. 

The setting is a fascinating mix of post-apocalyptica and alien environs; think Morrowind meets Mad Max. This setting does an excellent job pulling you in and getting you immersed in its little details. I found myself drawn into the complex political and ethical landscape of Kenshi, hungry to learn more about why basically all the factions are bastards. 

If you are into sandbox games in which you try to eke out an existence in a harsh, living world, this one is for you. 

P.S.
There are always more Fogmen than you think. Prepare accordingly.

You really won't find a game that has as much charm as Kenshi

Kenshi is a masochist combat simulator, there is no real goal in Kenshi and this game is incredibly wonky but that is exactly what makes it an amazing game, it's buggy in all the right places and encourages you to abuse these bugs for funny experiences

Kenshi also has incredible world building and the game changes depending on your actions within the world... do you wanna be the hero of the people?  destroy the slavers and free the slaves... do you wanna be a mass murderer?  kill everyone without mercy... do you wanna live as a vegetable?  fight someone massively stronger than you and watch as they one shot your body parts while you enter a coma in the middle of the desert... do you wanna be a combat god?  train like crazy so you make someone else enter a coma in the middle of a desert

The game also has a really big workshop modding community so if you want something new, there is always new stuff to add

185207200.review: I want to tell you to play Kenshi, but, I must warn you.  You will never go back, you will never be the same.  Your whole life will be consumed with thoughts of how to minmax your build, how to get a few more points of athletics on your main runner before you head to mongrel, checking to see if you'll be able to outrun or fight off whatever you might encounter, only for you to set off on your journey and realize something amazing is happening at the city gates, and you have to put your trip on hold to investigate.  a few minutes of fighting, looting, and bandaging later, and you're several thousand Cats richer and sporting a couple new pieces of gear, maybe a few bandages.  You set off on your trip, only now, you're a little slower because of the new gear and items, and you don't notice it, so when you get chased by whatever you would have outrun before, it slowly starts to gain on you, and in a panic, you realize why, your encumbrance is too high! in a panic, you pause and open the menu, throwing items to the ground, unpause, pause, check speed, okay just high enough to get away! you unpause and start running away again, blindly fleeing your pursuers, not paying attention to what is in front of you, until the fog swallows you up.  You start to hear it, all around you, the sounds of....chewing....before you can even make sense of anything, you're deep in a fog bank, lost, and suddenly you get the warning that you're in combat! but you can hardly see anything, so you zoom in, and that's when you see THEM.  Dozens of them, swarming around your hapless little runner, beating you with pipes and ready to dive on your fallen body as soon as it hits the ground.  Nothing but a few discarded clothes and bandages will remain to mark your passing and no one will mourn you.  This, is Kenshi.

185161651.review: One of my favorite games of all time. I've played as a mercenary, a traveling trader picking up scraps from a recent fight, a warlord amassing large groups to defeat the Okranites, a hemp farmer/drug dealer, The world is expansive and you learn the lore by just exploring and listening to NPC convos. You are not the main character but if you get your ass kicked enough even beak things are child's play. The point of being a nobody in a harsh world that can be beaten up by a starving bandit to a godlike being that can pretty much solo anything is so satisfying. Base building is fun but not my main focus like for some people. I recommend playing as green-lander or skeleton. Go straight to Squin to mine copper ore for starter gear and food. Fight the occasional bandits and train your skills a bit then go to vain to train. I know beak things can kill you easily but you get a bonus for fighting stronger enemies. If you survive your encounters you'l have a bad-ass in no time. Go to the fog-islands and recruit Beep I promise you will enjoy his dialogue.

185161106.review:
Kenshi is honestly one of the most unique games I've ever experienced. When I first played it, I actually hated it. I thought I got suckered in by a recommendation from a friend who said it was one of the best games he's ever played. After I quit the game and let it sit for a month or two, I had an inkling to return and I'm glad I did.

This game will have you getting your ass kicked by starving bandits for the first week, until you can eventually take on and kill the bandits yourself. Then you upgrade to the next tier of bandits, so on and so forth and before you know it, you and a ragtag group of misfits are spending your time making illegal narcotics for profit, destroying entire civilizations, or making and selling food.

My only real advice is that going into this game blind is an absolute treat and I wish I could experience it for the first time again. That and to save often.

Absolutely worth even full price.

185154608.review:
Yes with an asterisk.

The graphics are simple, the animations a bit basic, and the UI kinda harsh.  But honestly, those are all fine - the complexity of this game is pretty high, there's a lot going on at any given time, and the world is positively enormous.

That said...the AI is still really derpy on both sides.  I've had defensive characters just sit there while the base gets attacked, and then the enemies get inside and race into the only building in the outpost and just stand there doing nothing.

My biggest issue with the game is the difficulty balance.  And yes, I know that the difficulty is partly the point - you're intended to start weak and useless and slowly build up.  But the game's unforgiving pacing in some areas means you can't actually build up - you spend most of your time unconscious or in bed recovering from injuries, and then as soon as you get up and go somewhere you get attacked again.  Training options to safely increase your power are nearly nonexistent, and can't help you survive.  Armor crafting is expensive to research and requires materials that are hard to safely obtain.  And you eventually hit a progress wall that forces you out into the wilderness without direction or guidance, risking incredibly dangerous places that you may not survive in order to find Ancient Science Books that will let you research further.

I absolutely think this is a good game for a small/solo dev, with a lot of thought and worldbuilding depth to it.  It's kind of the Dark Souls of RTS/simulation.  If that's your jam, play Kenshi.

But if you want to have any idea what you're doing, how to improve, and where it's safe to build...or if you want to spend less than a third of your playtime just watching a character run through the empty wastelands between two cities...maybe give it a pass.  After 33 hours, 10 of which have been spent with 18 of my 20 characters in bed because I keep getting attacked and thus can't even really work on my defenses or base, I think I'm calling it for me.

185052279.review:
Я, честно не понимаю откуда у игры столько положительных отзывов... большинство из которых: "ха-ха, я шёл по пустыне и меня забрали в рабство" или "ха-ха вышел из города, схватили людоеды и съели меня целиком"... ВАУ! вот это игра... явно достойна положительного отзыва от тех людей которые это писали. 

Поиграв несколько часов в эту "игру" я понял, что в ней просто нечего делать, эта игра песочница, в стиле - развлеки себя сам. При этом развлекать себя особо нечем... да и не прям чтобы весело... ужасная оптимизация, лаги, баги, не самая приятная графика, управление и отзывчивость персонажем не дают тебе развлечь себя самого, в этой так сказать "игре". Если бы эта игра вышла в году так - 2005, то возможно это была бы отличная игра, но для того года в котором она вышла, она выглядит явно устаревшей по всем аспектам. Вариативности мало, геймплей дубовый, оптимизация отвратная, локации пустые и бездушные, графика на уровне 2005х, диалогов как таковых нет, отыгрыша роли как такового тоже нет, т.к. он ни на что особо не влияет. В этой игре ты просто "НПС", который отличается лишь тем, что может прокачать себе статы до неадекватного уровня, по сравнению с другими НПС и выносить всё что движется. На этом пожалуй всё... В этой игре вообще ничего по сути нет, ни интересного геймплея, ни сюжета, ни интересных диалогов, НИ-ЧЕ-ГО... она просто пустая и бездушная.

Покупая эту игру, я понимал о чём эта игра, я понимал что она не из лёгких в плане освоения, я понимал что у неё не самый низкий порог вхождения и данная игра скорее не для казуальных игроков. Я люблю сложные, необычные и интересные игры, а также игры которые бросают вызов игроку и не "ведут его за ручку". Но в этой игре нет ни того ни другого. Это просто сплошная духота с однообразными и блеклыми локациями (местами красивыми и завораживающими)... а если вкратце это просто большие локации в пустоши/пустыне... ВСЁ! то есть это просто громадная, пустая, и бездушная пустошь, где разбросаны поселения/города. И вы наверное спросите: "а что ты хотел от пустоши?" Ну я бы ответил что-то типа: "того что я видел в Fallout".

Здесь нет, как таковых привычных многим квестов, здесь нет интересной боевой системы, здесь нет приятного управления персонажем, здесь вообще практически ничего нет. Всё что здесь есть, это пустые локации и геймплей в стиле "развлеки себя сам" или игра в стиле "очень глубокая, которую не все поймут". Из плюсов, я могу выделить разве что неплохую и местами приятно-меланхоличную атмосферу.

В общем и целом: это кривая, бездушная и при этом душная игра, которую могу порекомендовать лишь тем игрокам, кто устал вообще от всех игр, которые прошли тысячи игр и им нужно что-то "нестандартное". 
Для людей которые хотят поиграть в интересную игру... я однозначно не рекомендую, хотя может вы найдёте что-то в этой игре, интересное и затягивающее... Я, к сожалению, за ~10 часов геймплея - не нашёл. 

Дополню этот обзор тем, что игра не выглядит полноценной, это больше похоже на альфу версию той игры которую запланировали изначально. То есть у игры определённо есть какая-то идея и возможность стать чем-то большим, но складывается ощущение что игру просто не допилили, она просто пустая и безжизненная, хотя потенциал у игры определённо есть, ей определённо есть куда расти и развиваться, в ней есть какая-то изюминка и есть что-то такое, что цепляет, это "что-то" мимолётное, не доведённое до ума. Это та игра, которая могла бы быть неплохой, если бы её отполировали и внесли бы в неё больше возможностей, игровых механик и интереса в целом, т.к. идея игры сама по себе действительно не плохая, местами завораживающая и интересная, но на данный момент, это игра без души...
5/10

185042536.review:
The thing about this game is that it's staggeringly ambitious especially when compared to contemporary games where the list of "things you can do/affect" is low and the core loops are shallow or repetitive (but often still pleasing). Kenshi is one of the most thorough sandboxes ever crafted and you really can do a lot of crazy, fun stuff in this game. It plays like an even more open/flexible/diverse Mount and Blade game and people will see similarities right away. If you like losing yourself in a world, an emergent narrative, a character or characters you create, or meet, and grow attached to... Kenshi has a lot to offer.

It's a CRPG, a base-builder, a lifesim, an RTS, a survival game, a strategy/conquest game, and even has dungeon crawler elements on occasion. You have an impact on the world, if you want to, and that impact is reflected in various "world state" functions and other interactions that can slowly but surely alter the landscape of your run. The world of Kenshi is mysterious, unique, and bizarre. It has its own strange, obscure lore and secrets to discover. It also has its own "samurai/ninja punk" aesthetic that reimagines the "weird wasteland" as a fusion of cyberpunk, post-apoc, and anime in a bleak world that can be made even bleaker or maybe a little less bleak... it's up you.

It was almost a one-dev show, however, and the jank has persisted across the years. People should know about this going in -- performance and functionality can require finessing and patience with this game, especially if you mod it. The modding scene is very active and relevant, helping to sand down rougher edges as well as offering new ideas that expand on what Kenshi already does. The scene has been around for years and while there are some big egos, it's nothing like the bizarre cults of personality, cyclical "controversies" and gormless infighting that plague the Bethesda modding scene. Basically, point is, if you have issues you can be sure others have before too and you'll be able to figure it out without enough patience.

185010147.review:
TL;DR - Kenshi is 10/10

Kenshi is an open-world post-apocalyptic survival RPG with a captivating 870 sq km world map full of vibrant zones and lore of an ancient era to discover. Think SIMS but instead of worrying about your character's hygiene and social life you have to worry about cannibals, slavers, blood spiders, religious zealots, bandits, ninjas, and evil robots.

Explore alone with an old rusty katana, or with a thirty-person squad armed to the teeth with polearms and crossbows. Live as a nomad or create a network of farms and forts and secret towers. Trade goods, smuggle hash, or steal. Collect bounties on wanted individuals, or free slaves from captivity. Raid ancient ruins for powerful forgotten technology or get eaten alive by swamp raptors. Kenshi is a non-linear experience that leaves players with a plethora of different playstyles to explore in a chaotic and unforgiving sandbox of possibilities.

The allure of the world has blinded me to the dated graphics, but there have admittedly been some bugs I couldn't easily overlook. I have had to use Shift-Alt-F11 to unstick characters before, so keep that in mind. Not sure how this works to unstick them, this is just something I found online and it has worked several times. Also, I have experienced some crashes when the game speed is maxed out and I am walking from one map zone into another. Pausing briefly and allowing the game to load (when it says "loading" but still lets me move the camera/take actions) and saving before walking a long distance has all but completely negated the frustration I was experiencing with these crashes.

If this was an [insert AAA developer here] release with a massive studio and team behind it, I would have lowered my rating due to the aforementioned performance issues. However, Kenshi was created largely by one person and deserves as much slack for its shortcomings (I doubt they had an army of play testers) as praise for its innovations.

All that to say that I am having a wonderful time playing this game and you probably will also. 10/10.

184920793.review: Kenshi é um dos jogos mais únicos que já joguei, por mais que pessoas apontem alguns 4X como similares, mas acredito que Kenshi seja muito mais caracterizado como um RPG, cujo foco está na jornada. Tive uma ótima experiência com o jogo pela liberdade a qual ele dá ao jogador, possibilitando inúmeras gameplays diferentes, seja escolhendo uma outra facção para se aliar, seja escolhendo focar mais na aventura ou na construção de uma base. No entanto, é necessário destacar que há alguns problemas com o jogo. Mais especificamente, é clara uma falta de alguns conteúdos, como a falta de diálogos após um tempo de gameplay, a falta de consequência para certas ações e a falta de desenvolvimento de muitos personagens. Claro, para algumas pessoas isso é bom, pois lhe permite focar no seu próprio RP, porém eu pessoalmente após um bom tempo jogando preferi instalar mods para optimizar minha gameplay. Concluindo, Kenshi, por mais que careça em alguns aspectos, é um dos meus jogos favoritos e uma das melhores experiências que tive com jogos que oferecem liberdade ao jogador, portanto, caso esse seja o seu interesse, recomendo e muito comprá-lo.

[h1]Un monde vivant et dangereux[/h1]
L’essence de Kenshi réside dans son monde ouvert, [b]dynamique[/b] et [b]imprévisible[/b], où chaque coin de l’horizon réserve une nouvelle surprise. Les factions s’affrontent dans des batailles acharnées, les caravanes sillonnent les dunes à la recherche de profit, tandis que les pilleurs guettent la moindre faiblesse. Les tempêtes de sable ou la faim peuvent devenir vos pires ennemis, mais ce sont souvent vos propres[b] erreurs stratégiques[/b] qui scellent votre sort. Survivre dans ce monde, c’est [b]apprendre [/b]à [b]anticiper[/b],[b] improviser[/b] et [b]s’adapter[/b] face à des défis constamment renouvelés.

[h1]Une liberté exigeante[/h1]
Dans Kenshi, [b]aucune règle [/b]ne vous dicte votre conduite. Vous pouvez devenir marchand, guerrier, ou esclave en fuite, ou encore un bâtisseur rêvant de créer une enclave sûre dans ce chaos ambiant. Cette liberté [b]dépasse les limites[/b] habituelles des RPG, offrant une expérience où [b]tout est possible[/b], mais rien n’est facile. Chaque choix que vous faites où aller, qui aider, ou même quand fuir est à la fois une opportunité et une prise de risque. Cette absence totale de guidage transforme le monde en une [b]toile blanche[/b] où vous êtes libre d’écrire votre propre destin, renforçant une [b]immersion rarement atteinte dans le genre.[/b]

[h1]Une fresque personnelle dans un monde impitoyable[/h1]
La [b]progression [/b]est lente mais [b]gratifiante[/b], où partir de rien pour construire une forteresse ou diriger une équipe reflète votre évolution. Chaque échec pousse à repenser ses stratégies, chaque victoire apporte une [b]fierté méritée[/b]. Avec ses paysages arides, ses villes décrépites et une bande-son minimaliste, le jeu instaure une ambiance oppressante unique. 
Kenshi exige du temps et de la patience, mais en retour, il offre une épopée où chaque décision compte et chaque histoire est à vous.

184879599.review:
Кенши — это мир, где даже самая светлая надежда может быть растоптана жестокостью обстоятельств.

Моя история началась с Мади — честной работницы, которая пережила несправедливые аресты и продолжила работать, несмотря ни на что. Вместе с Элсом, человеком с тяжёлым прошлым, они строили жизнь, полную труда, утрат и маленьких побед. У них была собака, были мечты, была цель. Но судьба оказалась немилосердной: самураи снова схватили Мадю, убили их собаку, а Элсу пришлось бежать, копя деньги на будущее.
Элс сражался за жизнь. Он избегал жуков, падал в руки работорговцев, терпел лишения. А Мадя, выйдя из тюрьмы, искала способ собрать 10 тысяч, чтобы вступить в фракцию. Но счастье было недолгим: на Элса напал жук, а городские самураи приняли Мадю за врага. Её убили, а Элс оказался в тюрьме.

Даже тогда Элс не сдался. Он сбежал, встретил спутницу, но снова потерял всё, оставив её на съедение паукам. В руинах, полных смертельной опасности, он нашёл лишь отчаяние. Дальше — путь через море, нападение жирафа, сломанные ноги. Добравшись до города, он встретил лишь безразличие стражников. Они оставили его умирать от голода.

Кенши — это не просто песочница, это испытание на прочность. Каждый шаг здесь — борьба, а каждая потеря — напоминание о том, как легко всё может рухнуть. Это игра, где герои не всегда побеждают, но их истории остаются с тобой навсегда.

184754373.review:
Kenshi is not a game, it is a complete world that mirrors our own in about 200 years after lord Elon and his puppet Trumm..something or other mandate the installation of service robots in everyone's home, everyone in the first world anyway. Then well They abandon us as a massive solar storm approaches and hide behind some larger asteroids in the outer reaches of our conventional rocket drives. They return and the bunkers they believed would contain everything they need to rebuild have been opened and used by the survivors of the solar fire. 

The Tesla Boy and his obese puppet are alarmed and trigger the domestic robots into restraint and comply mode. Most follow, plenty do not. The world splinters technology and manufacturing are hoarded by the few and released to the masses. Genetic engineering in the increased radiation from the atmosphere leads to monstrous and strange creations, hive like being thrive where humans cannot, religions rise and fall at alarming rates and so do their followers. Alien beings stranded on earth by the destruction of wormholes used for interstellar travel are forced to expose themselves and adapt to the new earth without their resupply ships. 

Most important of all is the massive reshaping of the earths landmasses forced together but massive waves created by the solar storm makes shipping redundant and natural defences of bodies of water almost nonexistent. You cannot retreat across the sea to your home, you fight or you die. Over hunting causes massive evolution in surviving animal populations to even the odds for the animals, with increased size, strength, neck length and finally intelligence. 

Much has happened in the many rotations around the sun but one thing remains unchanged you are going to have to find your own way in this harsh world because life is not a dress rehearsal. You want to be a loud sneak thief? you'd better learn to be a good slave, you want out? you'd better remember caravan travel times and slaver guard routes and then pick your lock decide who else you are saving or using as a distraction. Good luck

First playthrough: bought some food, left town, got enslaved, died in slavery.
Second playthrough: started as two enslaved dudes, didn't get in cages fast enough and died in slavery.
Third playthrough I'm a bugman assembling a group of anti slavers to rid the world of slave mongering empires. Currently over a month in game survived stealing from ancient monuments and doing research in my group's HQ in preparation to set up a more longterm base on a slaver route in order to release slaves and expand our reclamation of freedom.

If you don't need a game to hold your hand are are looking for a challenging RPG I definitely recommend this. This game has no story but the freedom it gives you to play with its world is rare and a lot of fun, the stories to can weave for yourself within it seems endless. 10/10.

184683526.review:
This is an extremely niche game that most people will not enjoy.

Kenshi is an indie game that plays as a traditional DnD 3rd person RPG, like Baldur's Gate or Neverwinter Nights but without magic. Besides the lore, the main differentiator seems to be that you start very weak, but it is somewhat difficult to die, and easier to get beaten to coma, enslaved, or losing limbs.

Although innovative, I cannot recommend this game. The game is barren, you cannot interact with almost any character but in very generic ways (sellers, hiring mercenaries, etc). It is like a Bethesda game with no dialog, no missions, magic, or interesting objects. Almost pure sandbox. You fail, fail, and fail more, and after hours and hours you get better at the things  you are failing. More grinding than skill, and very slow progression. 

The game is also janky, with plenty of bugs and outdated graphics, which does not add to the fun. Hopefully Kenshi 2 will be better.

184609930.review:
第一次听说kenshi这款游戏时还是六年前看一个mc咸鱼nor叔主播玩的，那会还在上中学，能接触电脑手机的时间很少，每次周末打开他的视频时都会发现他又连着更新了十几条20分钟+的视频，量大管饱，而他玩kenshi时费尽心思来回读档只为偷空武器店的操作更是带给我极大的震撼，也深深影响了我日后的游戏风格（指每个存档必有一个神偷，无论究竟靠不靠“智巧”赚钱）。还记得那时，看他在恒城的沙漠里与剪嘴鸥斗智斗勇，在蒙格勒把全队队友拉过来掩护偷窃，路过圣国农场时“免费”获得牛肉。。。种种神奇操作让我爆笑不止，也让我被这款画风复古的游戏深深吸引。
       迫于初中时的财政窘迫，只能从三大妈那里下学习版玩，亲自上手之后才发现，这个游戏并不是什么“古代小偷模拟器”，而是一个有着复杂背景故事，各种势力交错相争的开放世界废土探索游戏，正好赶上2020年的疫情，使我得以在初三的那个寒假获得大量时间亲自体验kenshi这个游戏的独到之处，在最初的探索中，我扛着牛偷遍了联合国大大小小的商店，把奴隶主敲晕关进笼子里再带上镣铐，在警察局大练撬锁神功（在此期间又看到了王老菊奴隶阿飞的励志人生系列视频，看到老菊火鸡般的捏人方式打开了通往新世界的大门），之后为了方便自己，在贴吧等地学会了如何给学习版打MOD（主要是堆叠上线，5xp之类的正义模组），在传奇城市斯昆招募了康将军，露卡等人，在五倍经验mod的加持下打了几个沙漠土匪，食人族之类的小怪后主角色属性大成，遂决定建国，招满49人并以班级同学命名（然而全让他们在营地里挖矿，种地了），在营地稍有起色，起码不至于饿死人之后孤身潜入环形山，绑架虫之主，在虫山虫海中冲进终极要塞转移仇恨然后直奔石魔，荣耀归于天生战狂兴奋的不行，但是偶遇夜晚对话bug，拼尽全力也无法招募濑户。之后便带队北上，以数十人闯入水泡山庄强杀圣主，把赛塔和瓦尔特纳送去跟雾人开篝火晚会，团灭圣国。
       之后疫情逐渐缓解，复工复课，在班中引起小规模的kenshi热，后在贴吧中得知大型模组虚空入侵，近乎重塑游戏遂开新档体验，迫于中考将至时间紧迫，百倍经验mod安排，第一次见识到力量破百指数增长之后出现的恐怖派大星人，被其一刀999的伟力震撼，为寻找并招募先天派大星圣体（指自带100以上力量的npc），开始学习使用fcs添加招募对话，组建了一支力量556的队伍试图横推全图，不料攻略虚空入侵卡特龙时忘记关掉经验mod在其数值急速膨胀后被一个哈利路大旋风反杀。。。
       中考之后的暑假很短，却因为中考的失利显得刻骨铭心，在此期间前后（看了下时间好像对不上但是我记得就是在中考后高二前）贴吧出现迪奥老母之怒，即后来的云水之间大型整合mod并引发了一系列风波，但作为一个从来没注册过的透明人我只关注从哪里可以下到好玩的大型模组，于是再开新档，开局被半岛人民共和国那个势力的隐喻吓到，但不妨碍我关掉经验mod，探索种种新奇的势力，种族和他们的故事，但这个存档才刚刚开始，便因为电脑只有8G内存便只能随着那个暑假的结束而消亡。
       之后因为已知设备达到极限，高中的时间也很紧，我逐渐忘记了这个游戏，糊里糊涂地过完了高二高三，感受了一波新冠疫情的铁拳，仿佛萧炎般地用高考狠狠打了某人的脸，也因此获得了32G内存，鸟枪换炮般的设备，在某“不让及格，不许回家”的威海分校半卷半混过了一年，恰逢冬促，再次看到这款熟悉的游戏，岂有不故地重游之理？
       荣耀归于天生战狂！

184605952.review: Любите когда вас жестко насилуют?? Тогда вам точно сюда. По началу вас будут насиловать все, начиная с бандитов заканчивая клювастой тварью. Из за этого опытные геймеры любят эту игру. Конечно он может выглядить устаревшим, не интересным. Но если вы попробуете начать, вас занесет на несколько десятков часов.

184560195.review:
КЕНШИ- ЭТО КОГДА ВСЁ И СРАЗУ

Мне нравится играть в игры с широким потенциалом самореализации. А уж особенно, когда эта самая реализация меняет мир вокруг. Игра и мир, её наполняющий, ощущаются живыми, изменчивыми и полноценными. 
За кого бы вы не начали играть в Kenshi, как бы вы не пытались накрутить своему персонажу широкие плечи и здоровенные руки в редакторе, в самом начале он- ничтожество. Он медленный, слабый, немощный и нищий. И этого несчастного с первых секунд выбрасывает в жестокий, беспощадный мир в котором рабство победило свободу, дегенерация победила прогресс, каннибализм победил человечность, а фанатизм победил рациональное познание и чистоту веры. Сложно даже понять, среди кого опаснее: среди разумных существ или среди плотоядных клювастых тварей живоглотов. 
И ты вынужден развиваться. Бежать из рабства, тренировать силу, воровать, похищать людей  в стан их врагов за денежное вознаграждение, сражаться с сильнейшими фракциями, либо же примкнуть к ним, размножая их тиранию.  В жестоком мире ты вынужден искать жесткие, не всегда правильные решения. И этим мир этой игры невероятно увлекателен. 
В игре можно чуть меньше чем всё. Можно строить свой город или разрушать чужой. Можно похитить всех лидеров фракции, что приведёт к её коллапсу и полному краху её поселений. Можно даже стать домушником разворовывающим добро богатейших мира сего. А с модами можно стать вообще кем угодно. Хоть диким туманником, сошедшим с ума без королевы, блуждающим без цели в толпе себе подобных ища лишь чужую питательную плоть. Короче, соскучиться тут ой как сложно. 
Искренне жду вторую часть. Это точно будет имба.

Parts of lore and graphic quality reminds me of Morrowind. Yes it is ancient and outdated game, and you would think this is bad thing, but NO, this game looks old in a GOOD way! Brings back that hype when you played games as a child (if you are "old" gamer like myself).

You have to learn a bits of lore in order to survive in that world, which is very nice and realistic.

For me personally, this game is masterpiece, and if you don't mind the "cons" I have highlightened in my review, there is huge chance that you will like it too.

I usually purchase "overwhelmingly positive" rated games since the bar for obtaining that status is quite high. 

But damn, this ain't it. 

The 2005-era RPG graphics, atrocious UI layout and general clunkiness aside, this game simply isn't worth the TIME it demands to do literally anything. I've put over 11 hours into it and haven't managed to do anything of any value. Maybe I'm just missing something and if I sunk another 30 hours into it trying to figure out how to actually play, then perhaps I'd understand the "overwhelmingly positive" reviews - but I can think of many better ways to spend my time and have no intention of opening this game again.

184508445.review: I picked this up during a recent sale and, despite my low playtime, I already know I’m going to get a lot out of that small purchase. I can’t really review this game though. I’ve spent most of my time running back and forth between the bar and a mining outcrop so I can sell ore. My first goal was to earn money to hire someone to be in my squad, then to buy a small shack, better weapons, buy training gear. Progress can feel really really REALLY slow but thinking about each small goal I’ve been able to accomplish, as well as fantasizing about exploring the massive map, building settlements and farms, and managing several squads at once has gotten me so excited that I’m already hooked. If you’re on the fence thinking Kenshi may be overwhelming,  it might not be a game for you. The UI is scary, leveling up can take ages, everything kills you instantly, and the game does not give you much guidance and I wouldn’t fault anyone for not liking it. I keep thinking about this game though. If you like creating your own stories in video games I can see you getting an insane amount of time out of this game. If you like squad based RPGs you’ll have some fun with Kenshi. And if you like Old School RuneScape levels of semi-AFK grinding you’ll fall in love with it.

184283158.review:
Hands down one of the best games ive ever played.  Kenshi is a squad based rts/rpg hybrid that throws you into its world and doesn't hold your hand.  The World of Kenshi is bleak and unyielding.  There's cannibals, insane bugmen, slavers, religious fanatics, robot bandits who will steal your skin or even murder giraffes who will stop at nothing until your dead.  Everything can and will attempt to kill you or repeatedly beat you within an inch of your life before you've even left the first fucking town.  You're not some chosen one, you're just another person in the world.  What you do in the world is entirely up to you.  You can do whatever you set yourself to do.  Hunt cannibals, be a merchant, be a builder of a settlement, or even topple existing governments and doom the world even more than it already is.  Its all up to you.  You build up your characters and their skills in accordance to how you want to play.  
While not much of a looker, and buggy at times, the depth this game has is incredible, and i absolutely recommend it.

184059770.review:
I'd recommend with some major caveats. The game is very unique, it's world and lore have some charm. However it is incredibly janky, and borderline broken in some aspects. The game attempts to be dynamic, with lots of different NPCs and random encounters but not a lot of it really works as I believe the developers wanted. 

Pros:  
Combat. The most fleshed out part of the game is the combat, which is actually pretty in depth and interesting. Your limbs can get damaged, even cut off if you're unlucky enough. If one of your body parts gets damaged too much you get knocked out and have to recover for a bit. The toughness stat will let your body parts take a lot more damage and allow you to wake up more reliably. Your team will slowly level up and get better gear throughout the course of dozens of hours and turn from completely useless to almost unbeatable.

 The most unique part of Kenshi is that when you're fighting human enemies it's very difficult for anyone to die. When someone is knocked unconscious nobody is allowed to attack them. You're almost guaranteed to be able to recover later if you have a first aid kit. This applies to enemies too, so sometimes it's a good idea to take their weapon before they wake up. Animals will eat you though, watch out for them.

Cons: 
The dynamic world isn't realised. There are plenty of factions, but their goals and personalities are hard to understand and sometimes non existent. For example there's a faction called the tech hunters, they're pretty cool and apparently like to search for lost technology. I've played for dozens of hours and I've never been able to talk to one (except shop keepers) or get any information about them at all. To me almost every faction so far has just been a faceless group with copy and pasted cities. I don't know what any of their goals are or how to help or antagonise them. 

The UI. Generally to navigate around the game and the UI is very frustrating. There's a base building part of the game, and the menus here are especially unfriendly to users. This is true in such a general sense it's hard to pinpoint anything. It's just all such a mess. Quality of life and care was not given very much attention. 

You can't actually play how you want. Every time you hear about Kenshi it's like "make your own story", "You can do whatever you want". That's not true. Do you want to be a farmer? Sure, you can make food. But first you'll need to train up a bunch of soldiers to protect your farm. And all the food is not worth making. There's no meaningful path of progression to being a farmer. It makes infinitely more sense to just buy food from the shops in fact.

Do you want to play as a lone trader? No you can't really do that, because you'll be attacked and eaten by animals going between cities. 

Do you want to interact with the factions and change the world of Kenshi? There are some ways you can help out factions, but there is absolutely no indication of what to do. And even if you do, you don't have a cast of characters to talk to. You don't know how anyone is doing or feeling. All the interaction with the world just falls flat. 

Conclusion:

If you've heard that you can do whatever you want, and are interested in roleplaying or interacting with the world, this game may be disappointing. If you're looking to get a group of soldiers and level them up and go around fighting people for no reason, this game has some in good systems that will keep you entertained if you're willing to micromanage a lot. It's not a bad purchase on sale, but it's hard to shake the feeling that a lot of things are missing.

184008166.review:
说在前头，作为个人制作的独立游戏，kenshi展现了非常完善的世界观和极为细节的内容设计，我很难想象完成这些工作需要花费多少精力心血和创意，这些都值得肯定。
但这不会影响我对这款游戏的总体评价，如果非要选择好评或差评，我会选择后者。我会在下文给予如此评价的理由，许多可能源于自己体验时间过短导致的理解不到位，但60+小时应当足够一款游戏向玩家传达它的优点，如果它做不到这一点，那这本身就是一个巨大的缺陷。

建筑：游戏的引擎和画风比较简陋，很多人最初可能很难接受这一点，但我毕竟玩过许多画风粗糙但内容精彩的游戏，这点只扣小分，连让我也感到难受的最大问题在于，该游戏中你建造的建筑被强制依靠地势，而游戏的地形凹凸不平，地基也不能被任何形式补平，这些问题几乎已经决定了你的据点中将充满了各种东倒西歪的建筑物。

生产：如果你忍受了上一部分，并且开始自己运作一个据点的生产链。那么对比环世界或缺氧这些游戏，你会发现kenshi的生产设计非常糟糕，游戏的生产从镇民的ai到作者提供的生产建筑，都十分粗糙。殖民会互相占着道卡死在一个楼梯上，又或者试图拿起材料建造物品，发现无法到达地点然后放弃，但很快再重新拿起这个材料，陷入一个死循环。针对建筑物的任务分配又让你需要不厌其烦的对每个镇民作详尽的分工，有时候因此还会忘了谁负责的是哪个田，谁又是这里的厨师。这样的地方比比皆是，游戏的生产环节很难称得上优秀，我理解个人开发的能力有限，但这并不是降低评价标准的理由。

操作：本游戏的战斗都是自动进行的，除非你想做些细节上的干预（不断逃离战斗以拉扯敌人或者潜行击晕等），否则你基本上只需要管一些购买物品，建造，和移动之类的决策性操作。这些方面的角色ai设计也很难称得上优秀。移动方面，作为一个地图极大的游戏，你经常需要横跨大片地图到达另外一个城市，或者征讨一个据点，这时你很容易发现（对我来说几乎是每次），一些角色停在半道中，他们将自己寻路到了死路，放弃了思考，即使试图重新为他们定位目的地，这些家伙也完全无动于衷，这个问题让人难以忍受。偶尔，你还会需要让一个角色从据点的箱子里拿起东西，去治疗同伴或建造建筑物，你转移完物资，关掉窗口，然后发现角色自己非常快速的小跑一步，把东西还回了储物箱。
